@SteveL-MSFT, your last commit had 12 failures in `PowerShell-CI-macos`
(These are 5 of the failures)

Send-MailMessage DRT Unit Tests.Can send mail message using named parameters with mandatory parameters
```powershell
Expected exactly 'user01@example.com', but got $null.

136:         $mail.FromAddress | Should -BeExactly $InputObject.From
```

@SteveL-MSFT, this is the reminder you requested 1 minute ago

@SteveL-MSFT, your last commit had 1 failures in `PowerShell-CI-windows`
Read-Host Test.Read-Host doesn't enter command prompt mode
```powershell
Expected exactly @('foo: !1', '!1'), but got @('!1', '!1').
at <ScriptBlock>, D:\a\1\s\test\powershell\Modules\Microsoft.PowerShell.Utility\Read-Host.Tests.ps1: line 43
43:         $result | should -BeExactly @('foo: !1','!1')
```
Looks like the failure is that on Windows, the prompt is written directly to the console but on non-Windows it's written to stdout.  Seems like writing to stdout is the right thing here.
Looks like on Windows, it relies on native console apis due to line input mode, so too big of a change to have it use .Net Console class.
Perhaps we could use our test module HelpersHostCS  on Windows.
@iSazonov this is a change in the console host so a test host doesn't help here.

:tada:`v7.0.0-preview.2` has been released which incorporates this pull request.:tada:

Handy links:
* [Release Notes](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases/tag/v7.0.0-preview.2)
